intro: Parasenecio lidjiangensis, commonly known as the Yunnan parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, thriving in cool and moist environments. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
